Pre-Game Insights: England will be without their regular ODI captain, Jos Buttler, who has been sidelined with a calf injury since the ICC T20 World Cup 2024 in June.
Liam Livingstone will captain the team in Buttler’s absence, marking a significant opportunity for him to lead the English squad.
West Indies, led by Shai Hope, are aiming for a bounce-back performance after their 2-1 ODI and T20I series defeats in Sri Lanka.
Cricket West Indies has made a single change to their ODI squad, bringing in left-handed batter Shimron Hetmyer in place of Alick Athanaze.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The England-West Indies ODI series holds strategic importance as both teams will aim to fine-tune their lineups and address gaps.
The series is a critical opportunity to assess form and build momentum for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.
For England, the series is a chance to reset after the recent defeat to Australia, while West Indies will look to establish stronger footing following their losses in Sri Lanka.
